title: Ideas for Notion
This is a list of features I would like to see in Notion.

inline_content.Text: This is a list of features I would like to see in Notion.

title: But first talks about the difference between Apple and Amazon.

inline_content.Text: But first talks about the difference between Apple and Amazon.

title: Steve Jobs had a business philosophy of focus. He wanted Apple to do few things very well. Obviously that strategy can work. If those few things happen to be extremely profitable, this can lead to a wildly profitable business.

inline_content.Text: Steve Jobs had a business philosophy of focus. He wanted Apple to do few things very well. Obviously that strategy can work. If those few things happen to be extremely profitable, this can lead to a wildly profitable business.

title: Jeff Bezos has an opposite business philosophy. Amazon started as a website selling books online but so did many few other businesses that we no longer remember. If Amazon followed Steve Jobs's philosophy and focused on just selling books online it would not be the business it is today. Instead Amazon expanded into a hundred other businesses. Not random businesses but businesses that build on its existing strength and businesses that add strength to its existing business. Selling more than books built on the strength of its existing customer base. Adding book publishing business adds strength to book selling business.

inline_content.Text: Jeff Bezos has an opposite business philosophy. Amazon started as a website selling books online but so did many few other businesses that we no longer remember. If Amazon followed Steve Jobs's philosophy and focused on just selling books online it would not be the business it is today. Instead Amazon expanded into a hundred other businesses. Not random businesses but businesses that build on its existing strength and businesses that add strength to its existing business. Selling more than books built on the strength of its existing customer base. Adding book publishing business adds strength to book selling business.

title: My ideas for Notion are Amazon ideas.

inline_content.Text: My ideas for Notion are Amazon ideas.

title: The core strength of Notion is how easy it is to write something.

inline_content.Text: The core strength of Notion is how easy it is to write something.

title: My ideas build on the core strength of editing interface and expand into more use cases. Some of them could be additional revenue streams and all of them would give people more reasons to use (and pay for) Notion.

inline_content.Text: My ideas build on the core strength of editing interface and expand into more use cases. Some of them could be additional revenue streams and all of them would give people more reasons to use (and pay for) Notion.

title: Pretty much all of those ideas are about taking content written in Notion and publishing it in a form optimized for a specific use case, be it a book, blog, API documentation.

inline_content.Text: Pretty much all of those ideas are about taking content written in Notion and publishing it in a form optimized for a specific use case, be it a book, blog, API documentation.

title: Blogging and simple website hosting

inline_content.Text: Blogging and simple website hosting

title: Whose milkshake Notion would drink: WordPress, GitHub pages. Medium, Netlify.

inline_content.Text: Whose milkshake Notion would drink: WordPress, GitHub pages. Medium, Netlify.

title: Blogging or building a simple website is still too complicated.

inline_content.Text: Blogging or building a simple website is still too complicated.

title: The idea is to allow people to publish sub-sections of Notion as a blog or a simple website.

inline_content.Text: The idea is to allow people to publish sub-sections of Notion as a blog or a simple website.

title: Additional features needed:

inline_content.Text: Additional features needed:

title: customized look
ability to pick a high quality template

inline_content.Text: ability to pick a high quality template

title: ability to provide custom CSS

inline_content.Text: ability to provide custom CSS

title: even more customization with templating i.e. the page is a data structure encoded as JSON and part of publishing process would allow people to provide custom code to generate HTML out of that data structure e.g. by adopting some well known templating language

inline_content.Text: even more customization with templating i.e. the page is a data structure encoded as JSON and part of publishing process would allow people to provide custom code to generate HTML out of that data structure e.g. by adopting some well known templating language
customized look

title: custom stats tracking i.e. ability to plug Google Analytics or other third-party analytics

inline_content.Text: custom stats tracking i.e. ability to plug Google Analytics or other third-party analytics

title: custom domains (possibly a paid feature like +$1/month). By default they would be hosted under notion domain

inline_content.Text: custom domains (possibly a paid feature like +$1/month). By default they would be hosted under notion domain

title: an explicit publishing step i.e. I want to make changes without publishing them and then click "Publish", maybe review the changes in a diff, and trigger public publishing

inline_content.Text: an explicit publishing step i.e. I want to make changes without publishing them and then click "Publish", maybe review the changes in a diff, and trigger public publishing

title: opt-in commenting. You already allow option to leave comments on the documents. This is a different kind of a comment, a blog commenting like Disqus. Not everyone wants comments so this should be an opt-in

inline_content.Text: opt-in commenting. You already allow option to leave comments on the documents. This is a different kind of a comment, a blog commenting like Disqus. Not everyone wants comments so this should be an opt-in

title: opt-in to Medium-like aggregation. Medium's business model is subscription so they force everyone into being part of Medium platform. Notion charges for editing, so there's no business imperative to build a Medium-like aggregation. But it building a recommendation layer on top of blogs/websites hosted by Notions does benefit writers (they can get more traffic from recommendations) and Notion (free SEO/content marketing).

inline_content.Text: opt-in to Medium-like aggregation. Medium's business model is subscription so they force everyone into being part of Medium platform. Notion charges for editing, so there's no business imperative to build a Medium-like aggregation. But it building a recommendation layer on top of blogs/websites hosted by Notions does benefit writers (they can get more traffic from recommendations) and Notion (free SEO/content marketing).

title: behind the scenes you need to build a Netllify-like or Medium-like or GitHub-pages like CDN hosting technology for efficient hosting of published content

inline_content.Text: behind the scenes you need to build a Netllify-like or Medium-like or GitHub-pages like CDN hosting technology for efficient hosting of published content

title: Such features should make many people switch from using WordPress or GitHub pages or Medium or Netlify to using Notion.

inline_content.Text: Such features should make many people switch from using WordPress or GitHub pages or Medium or Netlify to using Notion.

title: Book writing and publishing

inline_content.Text: Book writing and publishing

title: Whose milkshake Notion would drink: GitBook, leanpub, gumroad.

inline_content.Text: Whose milkshake Notion would drink: GitBook, leanpub, gumroad.

title: Many people write books but the friction of writing and publishing them is high (publishing either for free on the web or charging for digital format like PDF, epub or selling in Amazon Kindle marketplace or as physical, printed on demand books)

inline_content.Text: Many people write books but the friction of writing and publishing them is high (publishing either for free on the web or charging for digital format like PDF, epub or selling in Amazon Kindle marketplace or as physical, printed on demand books)

title: additional collaboration mode of "suggest a change"

this is meant to allow anonymous readers suggest small improvements. I don't want allow random people editing access but it would be helpful if someone could click "Edit" to start editing, make a small change and then click "Suggest a change". That wouldn't modify the master version but would generate a notification. The owner of the document would have a place to review those notifications and either apply them or dismiss them.

inline_content.Text: this is meant to allow anonymous readers suggest small improvements. I don't want allow random people editing access but it would be helpful if someone could click "Edit" to start editing, make a small change and then click "Suggest a change". That wouldn't modify the master version but would generate a notification. The owner of the document would have a place to review those notifications and either apply them or dismiss them.
additional collaboration mode of "suggest a change"

title: ability for anonymous readers to comment / ask for clarifications. This is like comments that are routed to writers so they can improve the docs based on feedback from readers. This is different from regular comments in that they are not meant to be live forever i.e. when a reader reports a typo the publisher will see it, fix it and the dismiss / delete that comment. There's no point on keeping feedback about issue that has been fixed.

inline_content.Text: ability for anonymous readers to comment / ask for clarifications. This is like comments that are routed to writers so they can improve the docs based on feedback from readers. This is different from regular comments in that they are not meant to be live forever i.e. when a reader reports a typo the publisher will see it, fix it and the dismiss / delete that comment. There's no point on keeping feedback about issue that has been fixed.

title: Expose identity / social

inline_content.Text: Expose identity / social

title: The biggest insight GitHub had was that people are more important than projects. Sourceforge, Google Code and everyone else were project first, people second.

inline_content.Text: The biggest insight GitHub had was that people are more important than projects. Sourceforge, Google Code and everyone else were project first, people second.

title: Twitter, blogging, Facebook, Instagram - they are all based on identity.

inline_content.Text: Twitter, blogging, Facebook, Instagram - they are all based on identity.

title: If you couldn't put a name on your blog, there would be way less blogs. Anonymous Twitter could not exist.

inline_content.Text: If you couldn't put a name on your blog, there would be way less blogs. Anonymous Twitter could not exist.

title: Notion should expose identity i.e. user names, like Twitter user name or Reddit user name, and promote people's public content.

inline_content.Text: Notion should expose identity i.e. user names, like Twitter user name or Reddit user name, and promote people's public content.

title: But we're a note taking application, like EverNote, why do we need identities in Notion?

inline_content.Text: But we're a note taking application, like EverNote, why do we need identities in Notion?

title: For the same reason GitHub put peoples first, not their code. People will use it more if there's a link back to their identity.

inline_content.Text: For the same reason GitHub put peoples first, not their code. People will use it more if there's a link back to their identity.

title: The big idea is that if someone has something to write and offer to the world, be it a single article, a blog or a book, Notion should be the tool they use to do it. But it all should be branded with their identity.

inline_content.Text: The big idea is that if someone has something to write and offer to the world, be it a single article, a blog or a book, Notion should be the tool they use to do it. But it all should be branded with their identity.

title: How does that turn in real features?

inline_content.Text: How does that turn in real features?

title: first, add user names. Notion url shouldn't be
notion.so/${doc_id}
a
http://notion.so/${doc_id}
but notion.so/u/{$user_id}/${doc_id}

inline_content.Text: first, add user names. Notion url shouldn't be

but notion.so/u/{$user_id}/${doc_id}

title: currently a publicly shared document for non-logged in users has a link back to Notion:
There should be a link back to profile page of the person who created that document.

inline_content.Text: There should be a link back to profile page of the person who created that document.

inline_content.Text: That page should show all content by that person.

title: Objections

inline_content.Text: Objections

title: But wait, can't I just make my Notion page public and share a link to it?

inline_content.Text: But wait, can't I just make my Notion page public and share a link to it?

title: You can but sometimes doing 80% of the work is equivalent to 0%.

inline_content.Text: You can but sometimes doing 80% of the work is equivalent to 0%.

title: For example I could designate a part of Notion as my blog but I won't do it because I really want to maintain my own identity (hosting the content on my own domain, not as part of notion.so) and I want customized look and I want Google Analytics stats.

inline_content.Text: For example I could designate a part of Notion as my blog but I won't do it because I really want to maintain my own identity (hosting the content on my own domain, not as part of notion.so) and I want customized look and I want Google Analytics stats.

title: Notion gives me 80% solution but I won't use it as a blog publishing system unless I get the remaining 20%.

inline_content.Text: Notion gives me 80% solution but I won't use it as a blog publishing system unless I get the remaining 20%.

title: The same applies to other use cases described here. When publishing a book I do want a custom domain, a nice book template etc.

inline_content.Text: The same applies to other use cases described here. When publishing a book I do want a custom domain, a nice book template etc.
